meanings.definition: Past tense of shy: to start suddenly aside, as in alarm or surprise
meanings.sent1: The cat shied away from the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She shied when the balloon popped unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The dog shied playfully when the squirrel darted by.
meanings.sent4: The horse shied at the sight of the waving flag.
meanings.sent5: The child shied from the spider, startled by its sudden movement.

meanings.definition: Past participle of shy: to throw with a sideways or oblique motion
meanings.sent1: He shied the ball towards the target.
meanings.sent2: The boy shied a stone into the pond.
meanings.sent3: She shied a pebble at the window to get her friend's attention.
meanings.sent4: The pitcher shied the ball with precision, striking out the batter.
meanings.sent5: The player shied the dart, hitting the bullseye with skill.
